item.title: Death Walks in Laredo
item.description: Death Walks in Laredo, is a 1967 Italian spaghetti western film directed by Enzo Peri and shot in Algeria. It is also influenced by the Sword-and-sandal film genre.

item.title: I due figli di Ringo
item.description: Two Sons of Ringo is a 1966 Italian western-parody film. It was the last film directed by Giorgio Simonelli who, for health reasons, left the production just before the end of filming and was replaced by Giuliano Carnimeo.

item.title: Holy God, Here Comes the Passatore!
item.description: Fuori uno sotto un altro... arriva il passatore is a 1973 Italian adventure-comedy film directed by Giuliano Carnimeo.

item.title: My Name Is Shanghai Joe
item.description: The Fighting Fist of Shanghai Joe is a 1973 Spaghetti Western kung fu film. The film was released in a number of alternate titles in the United States, including To Kill or to Die and The Dragon Strikes Back. The film was directed by Mario Caiano and stars Chen Lee as Shanghai Joe.

item.title: The Nephews of Zorro
item.description: The Nephews of Zorro is a 1968 Italian comedy film directed by Marcello Ciorciolini.

item.title: Man Called Invincible
item.description: Man Called Invincible is a 1973 Italian spaghetti western-comedy film directed by Giuliano Carnimeo.
